item.description: Passkeys were built to enable a password-free future. Here’s what they are and how you can start using them.

item.title: How to Back Up Your Android Phone (2025)
item.description: Do your future self a favor and back up all your precious photos, messages, and files before disaster strikes.

item.title: Worried About Losing Your Job? Pack a Digital Go Bag
item.description: It’s now more common for layoffs to happen through account lockouts. Every employee needs to download their most important files from work, and update them periodically.

item.title: 9 Best Hotel Rewards Programs for Elevating Your Next Stay
item.description: A guide to earning—and redeeming—points at Hilton, Wyndam, and other top hotels, whether you’re traveling for business or pleasure.

item.title: The Best Apps for Managing Your Travel Expenses and Receipts
item.description: Keeping track of your expenses while on a work trip can be frustrating. The editors of WIRED and Condé Nast Traveler pooled our expertise to find the most efficient and user-friendly apps for the job.

item.title: How to Clean Your Mattress (2025)
item.description: From barf to blood, your stained mattress isn’t necessarily beyond repair. Here’s how to salvage your investment from every worst-case scenario.

item.title: Still Using Windows 10? Here's How to Get Another Year of Updates for Free
item.description: If you’re not ready to upgrade, you can still get security updates until October 2026 by enrolling in Microsoft’s ESU program.

item.title: How to Spot and Guard Against Wrong Number Scams

item.title: Get the macOS Finder to Do Just About Anything by Typing Natural Language Commands
item.description: With the app Substage, users can type out file management tasks in plain English, then use the commands it generates to convert file types, manage folders, create zip files, and more.

item.description: With the app Substage, users can type out file management tasks in plain English, then use the commands it generates to convert file types, manage folders, create zip files, and more.
